title: RIP Stephen Hawking

embed.description: We were sad to learn that noted physicist, cosmologist, and author [Stephen Hawking](http://www.hawking.org.uk/) has passed away. In the spirit of...

body:
Just a few hours ago, after surviving half a century longer with ALS than his doctors expected, the world lost the greatest scientist in my lifetime.

Professor Stephen Hawking was my idol. It is thanks to him that I pursued Theoretical Astrophysics and Cosmology, and why, for the past few competitions, Achenar has had to suffer through my science papers.

Rest in peace.

{{sticker:sg-soraka}}

replies.body:
There are very few people who have ever lived, that I admire as much as him.
Proof that no adversity is too great if only you set your mind to it.

He did amazing work, that changed much of how we view science and the universe itself.
And on top of all that ground breaking research, perhaps one of his greatest achievements was actually one of his least scientific: 
Popularising science. 
Bringing real and interesting science into popular culture, and sparking interest. He was the trend setter for the new breed of 'rock star' scientists like himself, Brian Cox and Neil deGrasse Tyson. The impact of which will inspire countless new minds to pursue a career in science, that otherwise may not have gone down that path. Perhaps one day, a mind even greater than his own. Truly what legacy could be greater than that?

Rest in Peace Stephen Hawking. 
Few men and women in all of history will _truly_ never be forgotten, you sir are one of them!

The world lost one of it's best minds and biggest inspirations today.

Truly a loss that will be felt for centuries to come.
